section.heading: Preservation of secrecy.
section.text: In an action under this chapter, a court shall preserve the secrecy of an alleged trade secret by reasonable means, which may include granting protective orders in connection with discovery proceedings, holding in-camera hearings, or sealing the records of the action and ordering any person involved in the litigation not to disclose an alleged trade secret without prior court approval.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 5 of the Uniform Trade Secrets Act.
